title: Retro Word Association
description: Find the word that connects the retro-themed group!

puzzles.explanation: All these words are associated with vinyl records â€” 45s and LPs were record formats, and a turntable plays them.
You'd watch on a big screen from your convertible, eat popcorn, and hang a speaker box on your car window at a drive-in movie.
Rotary phones had a dial, shared party lines, needed operators to connect calls, and had a coiled cord.
Poodle skirts, saddle shoes, and bobby socks were the classic outfit for a 1950s sock hop dance.
You'd drop a nickel into a neon-lit jukebox, press the selection buttons, and it would play a 45 RPM record.
Transistor radios were portable, battery-powered AM/FM devices with small antennas.
Typewriters used an ink ribbon, had a carriage return lever, letter keys, and often used carbon paper for copies.
Early black and white TVs had rabbit ear antennas, showed test patterns, had only a few channels, and used knobs to change them.
Classic 1950s diners had spinning counter stools, served milkshakes, featured lots of chrome, and were famous for burgers.
Station wagons were known for their wood paneling, rear tailgates, family road trips, and the rear-facing 'way back' seat.
Roller rinks had disco balls, skating wheels, limbo contests, and couples skate sessions.
Arcades were where you'd spend quarters playing Pac-Man, chase high scores, and use joysticks.
Pinball machines have flippers, bumpers, a tilt mechanism, and a silver ball.
Polaroid cameras produced instant photos with white borders that people would shake, and had a bright flash.
Penny candy came in jars, cost just one cent each, and included treats like taffy and root beer barrels.
